bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Frank Carey to Philip Showalter Hench, June 2, 1950

div1.p: Carey requests Hench's permission to use an illustration in an article he is writing. He also requests a photograph of Camp Lazear Building No. 1 for the same article.

div1.head: Letter from Frank Carey to Philip Showalter Hench, June 2, 1950
div1.opener:
THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
330 STAR BUILDING
WASHINGTON 4, D. C.
JUNE 2, 1950
DR. PHILIP HENCH,
MAYO CLINIC,
ROCHESTER, MINN.
DEAR DOCTOR HENCH:
div1.p:
IN CONNECTION WITH A PLANNED ARTICLE ON WALTER
REED AND YELLOW FEVER, WE'D APPRECIATE YOUR PERMISSION TO USE
ARTIST'S CONCEPTION OF YELLOW FEVER EPIDEMIC IN SHREVEPORT AS
USED IN THE REPRINT OF YOUR ADDRESS TO THE INTERNATIONAL CONGRESS
ON MALARIA.

ALSO, COULD YOU SEND US A PRINT, OR PREFEREABLY,
THE NEGATIVE OF THE PHOTOGRAPH SHOWING YOU AND OTHERS STANDING
IN FRONT OF “BUILDING NO. 1.”
THANKS FOR YOUR HELP ON THIS.
